description: Level of Care indication engine. Threshold-based rules using domain severities and WM status.

then.rationale: Life-threatening medical condition or severe withdrawal requiring intensive medical management
Acute psychiatric crisis requiring immediate stabilization
Medically monitored withdrawal management with multiple severe dimensions
Multiple high-severity dimensions requiring intensive residential treatment
High-risk environment with moderate clinical needs requiring clinically managed residential
Multiple moderate severity dimensions requiring clinically managed population-specific residential
Moderate needs with supportive living environment—clinically managed low-intensity residential
Ambulatory withdrawal management with extended monitoring
Intensive outpatient with significant psychiatric needs—partial hospitalization
Moderate needs manageable in intensive outpatient setting
Low-risk withdrawal manageable in ambulatory setting without extended monitoring
Mild to moderate needs appropriate for outpatient services

evaluation_notes.description: Evaluate rules in descending priority order. Return the first rule where all 'if' conditions match.

aggregate_functions.count_severity_3_or_4: Count how many domains (A-F) have severity >= 3
aggregate_functions.any_severity_4: True if any domain has severity == 4
aggregate_functions.all_severity_below: True if all domains have severity < threshold
